body:
i'm thankful that i ate some blueberries for dessert last night instead of chocolate or ice cream or a pastry, even though i would have rather had chocolate or ice cream or a pastry. i'm thankful to know myself and know eventually i will not be able to resist those things (and don't want to live a life where i have to resist them forever), but i'm thankful to try to resist them for a while. 

i'm thankful that [it is not possible to eat too many clementines](https://twitter.com/AliaM_H/status/949475904937517063). i'm thankful for [the disappointing magic of spinach](https://twitter.com/BienSur_JeTaime/status/949076042786000897). i'm thankful for [american cheese](https://www.theawl.com/2017/12/american-cheese/?utm_content=buffer470fc&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer). i'm thankful for this list of [goldfish cracker flavors](http://distorte.tumblr.com/post/157659682690/this-wikipedia-entry-for-goldfish-cracker-flavours). i'm thankful [to have also literally just realized this](https://twitter.com/mollyguinn/status/950032768993517569). 

i'm thankful that though i spent like two hours trying to figure out what was wrong with my app yesterday and it was just that i needed to wrap an object in a string to send in a request rather than just sending the object, i did eventually figure it out.

i'm thankful for _[american war](https://www.amazon.com/American-War-Omar-El-Akkad-ebook/dp/B01LXK1HBB/ref=sr_1_1?s=digital-text&ie=UTF8&qid=1515340641&sr=1-1&keywords=american+war)_, which was a very gripping dystopian novel with a richly imagined world, even though i found its approach to race (in the context of a second american civil war)...lacking, an absence i kept thinking would be filled with critique or satire or something happening and then just...wasn't, imo. i'm thankful for _[the book of joan](https://www.amazon.com/Book-Joan-Novel-Lidia-Yuknavitch-ebook/dp/B01HBPNSNC/ref=sr_1_1?s=digital-text&ie=UTF8&qid=1515340611&sr=1-1&keywords=the+book+of+joan)_, which was a very trippy dystopian novel that felt like if kathy acker directed _the oa_. i'm thankful for _[the woman who smashed codes](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01M0EOI6I/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1)_, which i started last night.

i'm thankful for [reality winner](http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/12/who-is-reality-winner.html), who is an american hero.

i'm thankful for the first three episodes of the new season of _black mirror_, which have various holes that d and i like to make fun of together but i'm thankful that making fun of the show is part of what makes it enjoyable and not such a dour bummer machine (i'm thankful, though, for those bummers, thankful, re: "what if phones but too much," for critiques of technology, however ham-handed or melodramatic they may sometimes be, which i think are always more useful than empty acceptance or celebration of the status quo). i'm thankful for [jesse plemons](https://twitter.com/fakeirl/status/949490698008580096).

i'm thankful for the very important poll i started yesterday about [whether bruno mars is sexy](https://twitter.com/fakeirl/status/949808833429467136), which you still have time to vote in if you haven't yet. i'm thankful that we watched a trifecta of weird music videos last night after dinner: [finesse (remix)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LsoLEjrDogU), [motorsport](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9v_rtaye2yY), and [family feud](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z2kEKZ6jyQQ).

i'm thankful for [this perfect tweet](https://twitter.com/RuthCurry/status/949806333901107200). i'm thankful for the [etch to their own](https://twitter.com/CjEggett/status/949234760039182342) newsletter, which is a great place to learn about poetry (i'm thankful also that [pome](https://tinyletter.com/pome) is back). i'm thankful [tinyletter got a reprieve](https://twitter.com/fakeirl/status/949353283717619712) (but also weirdly kind of disappointed because imo mailchimp is a much better app).

i'm thankful "[when it gets cold enough the tides of lake michigan circulate water around chunks of free flowing ice that slowly grow as they tumble and it looks like blade runner](https://twitter.com/spookperson/status/949864010735788033)."

i'm thankful "[when it gets cold enough the tides of lake michigan circulate water around chunks of free flowing ice that slowly grow as they tumble and it looks like blade runner](https://twitter.com/spookperson/status/949864010735788033)."
